description: Visit the National Malaria Control Program in Tanzania
title: Malaria in Tanzania
content:
Malaria is a dangerous threat in Zambia, so it is important to take precautions and protect yourself and your family from the disease.  Here is how malaria affected Zambia in 2012:

 - 100% of the population of Tanzania was living in an at-risk area where the malaria parasite was present.

 - It is estimated that 8,300,000 people caught the disease, and 21,000 died, just from a simple mosquito bite.

 - Malaria also cost the economy of Tanzania approximately 1.2 Trillion Tanzanian shillings in lost productivity and treatment costs.

**How you can help**

It doesn’t have to be this way.  You can help protect your family, and your country, from malaria by taking a few simple steps:

 - Make sure your whole family sleeps under a bed net every night.

 - Seek testing, and then treatment, from a doctor or health worker at the first sign of illness.

 - If you are given treatment, make sure to finish your pills!
